page.title: 05POPULATION OF ASHTON
page.content:
Approximately sixty-five years ago the village of Ashton was well populated and contained far more people than it does at present. All the children in the village were sent to Breage School in the neighbouring village of Breage which lies less than one mile to the east of Ashton. In those days the local school had over 144 pupils on the school roll. Today the school has 14 pupils.
The total decline of tin mining and quarrying of china clay saw the main economic activity, apart from farming, disappear. This meant that a large part of the population migrated in search of work. Only three people today were born in the village of Ashton.
